example: To get the 6th term, for example, note that the 5th term has three (10 in ternary!) 1's, two (2) 2's and one (1) 1, giving 10 1 2 2 1 1.
mathematica: a[1] := 1; a[n_] := a[n] = FromDigits[Flatten[{IntegerDigits[Length[#],3], First[#]}& /@ Split[IntegerDigits[a[n-1]]]]]; Map[a,Range[25]] (* _Peter J. C. Moses_, Mar 24 2013 *)
author: _Thomas L. York_
